recentPerformance.last3Games: Season opener - lost by 58 points 3 days prior

keyFactors.title: Spread Overreaction to Game 1 Performances
keyFactors.description: 38.5-point spread = overreaction to Louisville's 59-point win (104-45 vs. South Carolina State) and Jackson State's 58-point loss (113-55 at #17 Illinois). Market overweighted single-game results.

keyFactors.title: KenPom Projects Only 28-Point Margin
keyFactors.description: KenPom projected Louisville 96, Jackson State 68 (28-point margin). 10.5-point gap between projection and spread line. 254-spot KenPom ranking gap but spread overcompensated.

keyFactors.title: Buy Game Dynamics Favor Underdog
keyFactors.description: Power 5 elite vs. SWAC buy games typically 30-40 point margins, NOT 40+. Louisville's goal: Win comfortably, stay healthy. Next opponent: #9 Kentucky in 5 days (rivalry game priority).

keyFactors.title: Jackson State Offensive Competence
keyFactors.description: Three capable guards: Daeshun Ruffin (SWAC Preseason POY), Jayme Mitchell Jr., Dorian McMillian. Capable of 65-75 points with competent shot selection. 40.7% from three in game validated offensive capability.

keyFactors.title: Louisville Pace Control Expected
keyFactors.description: Pat Kelsey's substitution patterns: Focus on development over margin. Played 13 players (deep bench reduces offensive efficiency). Once lead hits 30-36, no incentive to run up score.

riskFactors: Louisville's 10-0 all-time record vs. SWAC teams
Pace: Louisville expected 70-75 possessions (high volume could blow out margin)
J'Vonne Hadley OUT (starting forward, concussion) and Kasean Pryor rusty (first game back from ACL)

quarterBreakdown.description: Louisville 55, Jackson State 35 (20-point lead). Louisville's 19-0 run took 21-6 lead early. Jackson State shot 40.7% from three to stay within striking distance.
Louisville opened 2nd half with 16-4 run (extended lead to 33). Largest lead reached 36 points at 14:21 remaining. Jackson State within cover range.
Louisville scored 51 in 2nd half but pace slowed. Jackson State scored 35 (even period). Once lead hit 33-36, Louisville eased off.
Louisville played 13 players (deep bench reduced offensive efficiency). Pat Kelsey focused on development over margin. Jackson State covered +38.5 by 2.5 points.

gameResults.whenCleared: Covered +38.5 spread when Louisville's lead maxed at 36 points (exactly 2.5 under spread). Louisville never extended lead beyond 36 in final 14 minutes.
gameResults.gamePace: 176 total points (vs. projected 164). Higher scoring than expected (+7.3%) but pace controlled in 2nd half prevented blowout extension.
gameResults.foulTrouble: No significant foul trouble. Louisville turnovers (17) vs. Jackson State (12) kept game closer than talent gap suggested.

whatWentRight.title: Jackson State Offensive Improvement (PRIMARY FACTOR)
whatWentRight.description: Shot 39.7% FG (vs. 30.6% against Illinois 3 days prior). Shot 40.7% from three (11-27, excellent efficiency). Three players scored 18+ points: Balanced attack kept offense flowing. 70 points exceeded KenPom's 68-point projection.

whatWentRight.title: Louisville's Pace Control
whatWentRight.description: Scored 106 but didn't push tempo aggressively in 2nd half. 2nd half: 51-35 (even period, Louisville eased off). Once lead hit 33-36, no incentive to run up score.

whatWentRight.title: Buy Game Context Played Out
whatWentRight.description: Louisville's goal: Win comfortably, stay healthy. Next opponent: #9 Kentucky in 5 days. Risk of injury pushing score past 40+ not worth reward. Pat Kelsey's substitution patterns: 13 players, focus on development.

whatWentRight.title: Injury Impact Helped Cover
whatWentRight.description: J'Vonne Hadley OUT (starting forward, concussion protocol). Kasean Pryor rusty (first game back from ACL tear, only 6 pts in 16 min). Missing/limited starters reduced blowout potential.

statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: Massive improvement from 55 points to 70 points

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Expected outcome based on spread overreaction. The 38.5-point spread overreacted to both teams' opening games (59-point win vs. 58-point loss). Line failed to account for: (1) Jackson State's regression to offensive competence (30.6% FG to 39.7% FG), (2) Louisville's natural tendency to ease off with 30+ point leads in buy games, (3) Kentucky game 5 days away (health preservation). KenPom projected only 28-point margin, and buy game dynamics typically result in 30-36 point finals rather than 40+.

closingLineValue.verdict: Minimal CLV (+5 cents). Line moved slightly toward Jackson State as sharp money recognized spread overreaction. Market efficiency limited CLV opportunity.

keyTakeaways: Buy game dynamics in college basketball: Favorites win comfortably (30-36 pts) but rarely blow out past 40+
Spread overreactions to single-game results create value - market overweighted blowout results
KenPom projections (28-point margin) more accurate than market spread (38.5 points)
Jackson State's three capable guards provided enough offense (70 points) to stay within cover
Louisville's conservative 2nd half (51-35) prevented blowout extension - next game priority mattered
Health preservation in buy games is REAL - teams don't risk injury for meaningless points
Largest lead 36 = exactly 2.5 points under spread (barely covered but process was sound)
verdict: Sound process. 38.5-point spread dramatically overreacted to opening game results. KenPom's 28-point projection + buy game dynamics (30-36 typical finals) = strong case for Jackson State +38.5. Edge realized through Louisville's pace control and Jackson State's offensive regression to competence.
